metadata.synopsis: Embattled corporation Everything Except Shoes, or E.E.S., hires celebrity Ricky Coogin (Alex Winter) to serve as its spokesperson amid a spate of reports that the company uses a toxic substance in the products it manufactures. Ricky travels to South America to dispel the rumors, but instead he stumbles upon an oddball amusement park run by the demented Elijah C. Skuggs (Randy Quaid). It turns out that Skuggs is using the substance in E.E.S. products to turn humans into grotesque mutants.

reviews: It's unwatchable if viewed when sober.
what happens when you get a bunch of hipsters too weird for their own good in a room together and ask them to come up with something funny
A wacky bag of pleasure. The cameo's are great
Awesome comedy. Very clever bits and references and an awesome cast!
...in its genuine weirdness, a real Hollywood rarity.
Shockingly freaky and often very funny.
If you're tired of computer-generated visuals then you'll appreciate the domestic feel of the film's effects
